description: It looks for a target site duplication, a polyA in 3′ and an endonuclease cleavage site in 5′ to calculate an overall score of retrotransposition. The tool will be useful for indepth analysis of non-autonomous retrotransposons in sequenced mammals to help us understand retrotransosition in our evolutionary tree.
name: RTanalyzer

metadata.abstract: Mobile genetic elements have significantly contributed to the shaping of mammalian genomes. The RTAnalyzer software tracks sequences of retrotransposed origin by scoring the signature results from an L1-mediated insertion within a genome. More specifically, a sequence of interest is searched for in genomic databases using BLAST. Each hit, along with additional 50 and 30 sequences of pre-defined lengths, is saved. RTAnalyzer searches for specific L1 retrotransposition signatures (i.e. target site duplication, endonuclease cleavage site and poly(A)), and then calculates an overall retrotransposition score. This score represents the likelihood of a given sequence originating from a retrotransposition event involving the L1 machinery. RTAnalyzer may be used under GNU public license, and is available at http://www. riboclub.org/ rtanalyzer. © 2007 The Author(s).
metadata.title: RTAnalyzer: A web application for finding new retrotransposons and detecting L1 retrotransposition signatures
